pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 Wen2 xue2 Jiang3

sentences.english: In 1954 Hemingway won Nabel literary award.
He was the first American to win the Nobel Prize for Literature.
sentences.chinese: 他是第一位获得诺贝尔文学奖的美国作家。

sentences.english: Nobel Literary Prize Down to Merit, Not Judges' Whim.
sentences.chinese: 诺贝尔文学奖论功封赏，非评判随心所欲。

sentences.english: Toni Morrison is among the few American Nobel Laureates for Literature.
sentences.chinese: 托妮莫里森是少数美国诺贝尔文学奖得主是。

sentences.english: Pearls Sydenstricker Buck is one of few female Nobel Prize winner.
sentences.chinese: 赛珍珠是为数不多的女性诺贝尔文学奖获得者。

sentences.english: He was awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1971.
sentences.chinese: 1971年，聂鲁达荣获“诺贝尔文学奖”。

definition: Nobel Prize/abbr. for 諾貝爾獎|诺贝尔奖[Nuo4 bei4 er3 Jiang3]
Mao Dun Literature Prize, PRC prize for novel writing, awarded since 1982
William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet
Oe Kenzaburo (1935-) Japanese novelist and 1994 Nobel laureate
MURAKAMI Haruki (1949-), Japanese novelist and translator
School of Minor-talks, one of the Hundred Schools of Thought 諸子百家|诸子百家[zhu1 zi3 bai3 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
Alexandr Solzhenitsyn (1918-2008), Russian writer, prominent Soviet dissident, author of the Gulag Archipelago
Gao Xingjian (1940-), Chinese novelist and Nobel laureate, author of Soul Mountain 靈山|灵山
William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet
